exceptions.exn: In environment X : eqType A : list X x, y : X Hy : y el filter (fun z : X => Dec (z <> x)) A Unable to unify "forall a : ?M1559, a el filter ?M1560 ?M1561 -> a el ?M1561" with "(fix In (a : X) (l : list X) {struct l} : Prop := match l with | [] => False | b :: m => b = a \\/ In a m end) y A".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: eqType
A: list X
x: eqType_X X

Goal:
rem A x <<= A

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Record eqType : Type := EqType { eqType_X : Type; eqType_dec : eq_dec eqType_X } Arguments EqType X%type_scope {eqType_dec}%function_scope : rename
rem = fun A x => filter (fun z : X => Dec (z <> x)) A : list X -> X -> list X Arguments rem _%list_scope
eqType_X = fun e : eqType => let (eqType_X, _) := e in eqType_X : eqType -> Type eqType_X is a coercion
in_rem_iff : forall x A y, x el rem A y < -> x el A /\ x <> y
rem_not_in : forall x y A, x = y \/ ~ x el A -> ~ x el rem A y
incl_lrcons : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), x :: A <<= x :: B -> ~ x el A -> A <<= B
incl_rcons : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), A <<= x :: B -> ~ x el A -> A <<= B
incl_shift : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), A <<= B -> x :: A <<= x :: B
eqType_CS : forall X : Type, eq_dec X -> eqType
EqType : forall X : Type, eq_dec X -> eqType
incl_lcons : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), x :: A <<= B < -> x el B /\ A <<= B
incl_sing : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A : list X) (y : X), x :: A <<= [y] -> x = y /\ A <<= [y]
cfind : forall (A0 : list ?X) (p : ?X -> Prop), (forall x : ?X, dec (p x)) -> {x0 : ?X | x0 el A0 /\ p x0} + {forall x0 : ?X, x0 el A0 -> ~ p x0} where ?X : [X : eqType A : list X x : X |- Type]
list_exists_not_incl : forall (X : eqType) (A B : list X), ~ A <<= B -> exists x : X, x el A /\ ~ x el B
filter_pq_mono : forall (X : Type) (p q : X -> bool) (A : list X), (forall x : X, x el A -> p x -> q x) -> filter p A <<= filter q A
incl_Forall_in_iff : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A), l <<= l' < -> Forall (fun x : A => x el l') l
incl_app_left : forall (X : Type) (A B C : list X), A ++ B <<= C -> A <<= C /\ B <<= C
remove_incl : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l1 l2 : list A) (x : A), l1 <<= l2 -> remove eq_dec x l1 <<= remove eq_dec x l2
filter_mono : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> bool) (A B : list X), A <<= B -> filter p A <<= filter p B
incl_map : forall (X Y : Type) (A B : list X) (f : X -> Y), A <<= B -> map f A <<= map f B
incl_nil_eq : forall (X : Type) (A : list X), A <<= [] -> A = []
filter_incl : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> bool) (A : list X), filter p A <<= A
incl_nil : forall (X : Type) (A : list X), [] <<= A
List.incl_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l1 l2 : list A), l1 <<= l2 -> map f l1 <<= map f l2
nodup_incl : forall (A : Type) (decA : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l1 l2 : list A), l1 <<= nodup decA l2 < -> l1 <<= l2
disjoint_incl : forall (X : Type) (A B B' : list X), B' <<= B -> disjoint A B -> disjoint A B'
not_in_cons : forall (X : Type) (x y : X) (A : list X), ~ x el y :: A -> x <> y /\ ~ x el A
list_exists_DM : forall (X : Type) (A : list X) (p : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> ~ (forall x : X, x el A -> ~ p x) -> exists x : X, x el A /\ p x
in_filter_iff : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (p : X -> bool) (A : list X), x el filter p A < -> x el A /\ p x
incl_filter : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l <<= l
list_cc : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (A : list X), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> (exists x : X, x el A /\ p x) -> {x : X | x el A /\ p x}
Seq_refl : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : relation A), Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x : A, Aeq x x
Exists_Forall_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, P x \/ ~ P x) -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Forall P l
remove' : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> A -> list A -> list A
remove : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> A -> list A -> list A
nodup : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> list A
list_cycle : forall (X : Type) (A : list X) (x : X), x :: A <> A
incl_Forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A), l2 <<= l1 -> Forall P l1 -> Forall P l2
incl_Exists : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A), l1 <<= l2 -> Exists P l1 -> Exists P l2
Seq_sym : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : relation A), Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y x
incl_tran : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), l <<= m -> m <<= n -> l <<= n
incl_app_inv : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 m : list A), l1 ++ l2 <<= m -> l1 <<= m /\ l2 <<= m
incl_app : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), l <<= n -> m <<= n -> l ++ m <<= n
